name: 02-Datadescription and Preparation
content:
Data Description and Preparation

Data Description

The dataset contains structured financial records across multiple domains:

  1. Product Table
  • Product_ID (Unique key)
  • Product_Name
  • Development_Cost, Selling_Price
  1. Sales Table
  • Sales_ID (Unique key)
  • Date (transaction date)
  • Product_ID (FK → Product)
  • Quantity_Sold, Selling_Price
  1. Development Costs
  • Development_ID (Unique key)
  • Date
  • Product_ID
  • Developing_Cost
  1. Expenses
  • Expense_ID (Unique key)
  • Date
  • Product_ID
  • Expense_Type
  • Amount
  1. Payment Due
  • Payment_Due_ID
  • Date
  • Payment_Due
  1. Capital Investments
  • Investment_ID
  • Date
  • Investment_Amount
  1. Equity Table
  • Equity_ID
  • Date
  • Equity_Type
  • Equity_Amount
  1. Asset Table
  • Asset_ID
  • Date
  • Asset_Type
  • Asset_Amount
  1. Liability Table
  • Liabilities_ID
  • Date
  • Liability_Type
  • Liability_Amount

Granularity: Transaction-level (can be aggregated monthly/quarterly for forecasting).

Variable Types: Numerical (sales, costs, investments), categorical (types of equity/asset/liability), temporal (dates).

Data Preparation

Steps include:

  1. Data Cleaning:
  • Handle missing/invalid entries (e.g., null amounts, incorrect dates).
  • Remove duplicates.
  1. Transformation:
  • Convert dates to standard format (YYYY-MM-DD).
  • Normalize categorical values (e.g., Expense_Type, Liability_Type).
  1. Feature Engineering:
  • Calculate Net Cashflow = Inflows – Outflows.
  • Create rolling features: moving averages, growth rates.
  • Generate ratios: expense-to-sales, debt-to-equity.
  1. Integration:
  • Merge datasets by Product_ID and Date for a consolidated financial view.

Kaggle/External References

If external references are considered:

  • Kaggle datasets on financial cashflow forecasting or corporate finance analytics may provide benchmark models and sample feature sets.

III. Model Training and Evaluation

Model Used

For forecasting:

  • Time-Series Models (ARIMA, Prophet, LSTM): Suitable for predicting inflows/outflows over time.
  • Regression Models: For explaining dependencies between drivers (e.g., sales and marketing spend).
